Step 2: Identify Relevant Information from Context
- The context does not provide any specific details regarding the personal life of either individual (e.g., age, occupation). Therefore, I will base my deduction solely on marital statuses mentioned in the question.

- Since both people were discussing their dating life, it can be assumed they might have different relationship statuses (single vs. married). Therefore, we need to determine who among them has a single partner based on the marital status mentioned in the question - "married."

- The Protestant man is married and discussing dating life with another person at the coffee shop. Since he belongs to the category of people having a different relationship status (married), it can be deduced that the Mormon man had a single partner based on the information provided in the question.
